title: fix: fix company not moving when moving a contact

body:
Fix #7102 

With this PR, when moving a contact, if the contact belongs to a company:
- if the company has only this contact, we move the the company to the new vault
- if the company has more than this contact, we create a new company to the vault, with the exact same information.

issue.title: [Chandler] Entreprise tab not updated when moving a contact
issue.body:
### ⚠️ This issue respects the following points: ⚠️

- [X] This is a **bug**, not a question or a configuration/webserver/proxy issue.
- [X] This issue is **not** already reported on [Github](https://github.com/monicahq/monica/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Abug) _(I've searched it)_.
- [X] I agree to follow Monica's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/monicahq/monica/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Bug description

When moving a contact to a different vault, enterprise is still referenced in the first vault, and not present in the second vault

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create 2 vaults (A and B)
2. Create a contact Alice on vault A. Set enterprise details
3. Ensure enterprise tab list the contact, and you can click it from here (you will be redirect to contact of vault A)
4. Move contact Alice to vault B.


### Expected behavior

Enterprise tab should be updated in vault B to list enterprise details of contact Alice

Right now, the vault A (tab enterprise) still list the user and enterprise, and when I click on it, I'm redirect to contact Alice in vault B.

Alice does not exist anymore on vault A, moving contact is ok.

### Environment

beta.monicahq.com (v5 a.k.a chandler version or main branch)

### Version of Monica

89b9f65

### Installation method

None

### Web server

None

### Database engine version

None

### Additional info

Hello, I am currently evaluating the Chandler version on the hosted version until a migration is proposed to migrate my self-hosted instance, thanks for the work you put in Monica & Chandler ! Here is a bug I've faced while messing around with some fake data, I'm not sure if this is indented, but this does not seems right ?

nodes.body:
